#summary Glossary of terms used in Project VINYL

This page will be used as a Glossary for terms used in Project VINYL.

----

*Admin*

Any User who works with VINL as a program, such as a system administrator, technical support professional, database manager, etc.

*Announcement*

A text-only message posted to one or more Classes by a Teacher which is visible to all Students in those Classes.

*Assignment*

A message posted to one or more Classes by a Teacher which is visible to all Students in those Classes; it contains a text description along with an optional due date and document(s) for Students to download.

*Class*

A collection of Students and one or more Teachers.

*Document*

A file in any format (text, images, etc.) that may be uploaded to, and downloaded from, VINL.

*Grade*

A numerical indicator of a Student's progress on an Assignment, uploaded by a Teacher and visible to the Student in question as well as any Teachers in the given class.

*Quiz*

A set of questions created by a Teacher that a Student must answer which may optionally be graded automatically; a quiz is most often composed in a simple format (multiple-choice, true/false, etc.).

*Reminder*

1) An automated reminder of a due date associated with an Assignment, given within a User-specified proximity to the deadline.  2) A note regarding an Assignment, Document, Quiz, etc. which a User may create for himself.

*Roster*

A list of Students in a given class, to which a Teacher may add or remove students and to which a Student may add or remove himself.

*Student*

A User with Student privileges (the ability to perform tasks described under the Student use cases).

*Teacher*

A User with Teacher privileges (the ability to perform tasks described under the Teacher use cases).

*Test*

A set of questions created by a Teacher that a Student must answer which is most often simply forwarded to a Teacher to grade manually due to its more complex question format (short-answer or open-ended questions, essays, etc.).

*User*

A collective term for a user of VINL, who may have Admin, Student, or Teacher privileges.
